title: Guide for Slick Developers
text: Slick decision analysis tool presents outcomes potential policy options across various states nature. App allows simultaneous presentation various performance indicators can account uncertainty states nature. Slick interactive allows users filter results live order explore robustness performance. Slick applied decision analysis context, specifically designed investigate performance fisheries management procedures tested management strategy evaluation (MSE).

title: Decision Analysis
text: Slick decision analysis tool presents outcomes potential policy options across various states nature. App allows simultaneous presentation various performance metrics can account uncertainty states nature. Slick interactive allows users filter results live order explore robustness performance. Slick can applied decision analysis context specifically designed investigate performance fisheries management procedures tested management strategy evaluation (MSE). Importantly App platform agnostic: results arising MSE framework formatted compatible Slick object can loaded visualized App. openMSE packages compatible Slick, include tools convert openMSE MSE results Slick format. information developing Slick objects please see Developer’s Guide.

what: MPs S4 class and functions — MPs-class
title: MPs S4 class and functions — MPs-class
text: object class MPs contains information management procedures (MPs) Slick() object.

title: MPs S4 class and functions — MPs-class
code: MPs() # Create an empty MPs() object  MPs(Metadata=data.frame(), Preset=list()) # Populate a MPs() object  MPs(Slick, lang='en') # return MPs slot from Slick object  MPs(Slick) <- MPs() # assign an MPs object to the MPs slot in Slick object

title: MPs S4 class and functions — MPs-class
text: lang Optional. Character string length 2 specify language (available).  'en', 'es', 'fr' Slick object class Slick() Metadata data.frame() specific structure. See Details Preset optional list() specific structure. See Details

title: MPs S4 class and functions — MPs-class
text: Metadata data.frame must n MPs rows following columns: Code: short character string identifying MPs. Used App() places room full label. Label: long character string (one word max two words) identifying MPs. Description: longer character string providing description MPs. Color: character vector colors use display MPs App(). Optional. provided, App try set sensible colors. multi-language support, Metadata slot can populated named list: names en, es, fr English, Spanish, French respectively. data.frame within list element must identical structure; .e., number rows column names list element must identical. Metadata slot accessed Metadata(MPs) modified Metadata(MPs) <- data.frame()

title: MPs S4 class and functions — MPs-class
text: Preset slot optional named list add preset buttons Management Procedure filters App(). name list element appear button App(). list element contain numeric values specifying MPs include. values must <= n MPs. Preset slot accessed Preset(MPs) modified Preset(MPs) <- list()`

title: MPs S4 class and functions — MPs-class
text: MPs(missingOrNULL): Create new object class MPs() MPs(dataframe_list): Create new object class MPs() MPs(Slick): Return MPs() object object class Slick() MPs(Slick) <- value: Assign object class MPs() object class Slick()

title: MPs S4 class and functions — MPs-class
text: Metadata data.frame specific structure, describing details management procedures. See Details section. Preset optional named list preset buttons filters App(). See Details section.

title: MPs S4 class and functions — MPs-class
code: myMPs <- MPs() Metadata(myMPs) <- data.frame(Code=c('MP1', 'MP2', 'MP3'),                               Label=c('Management Procedure 1',                                       'Management Procedure 2',                                       'Management Procedure 3'),                               Description=c('This is the description for Management Procedure 1',                                             'This is the description for Management Procedure 2',                                             'This is the description for Management Procedure 3')                               ) Preset(myMPs) <- list(All=1:3, FirstTwo=1:2)    # Multi-language df_es <- Metadata(myMPs) df_fr <- Metadata(myMPs) df_es$Description <- c("This is the Spanish description for Management Procedure 1",                        "This is the Spanish description for Management Procedure 2",                        "This is the Spanish description for Management Procedure 3") df_fr$Description <- c("This is the French description for Management Procedure 1",                        "This is the French description for Management Procedure 2",                        "This is the French description for Management Procedure 3")  Metadata(myMPs) <- list(en=Metadata(myMPs),                         es=df_es,                         fr=df_fr)   Metadata(myMPs) #>   Code                  Label #> 1  MP1 Management Procedure 1 #> 2  MP2 Management Procedure 2 #> 3  MP3 Management Procedure 3 #>                                          Description #> 1 This is the description for Management Procedure 1 #> 2 This is the description for Management Procedure 2 #> 3 This is the description for Management Procedure 3 Metadata(myMPs, 'es') #>   Code                  Label #> 1  MP1 Management Procedure 1 #> 2  MP2 Management Procedure 2 #> 3  MP3 Management Procedure 3 #>                                                  Description #> 1 This is the Spanish description for Management Procedure 1 #> 2 This is the Spanish description for Management Procedure 2 #> 3 This is the Spanish description for Management Procedure 3 Metadata(myMPs, 'fr') #>   Code                  Label #> 1  MP1 Management Procedure 1 #> 2  MP2 Management Procedure 2 #> 3  MP3 Management Procedure 3 #>                                                 Description #> 1 This is the French description for Management Procedure 1 #> 2 This is the French description for Management Procedure 2 #> 3 This is the French description for Management Procedure 3

title: Create or modify an OMs object — OMs
text: OMs() creates empty OMs object. slot OMs object can accessed modified corresponding accessor function. See Examples sections details.

title: Create or modify an OMs object — OMs
text: Metadata data.frame must n OMs rows following columns: Code: short character string identifying MPs. Used App() places room full label. Label: long character string (one word max two words) identifying MPs. Description: longer character string providing description MPs. Color: character vector colors use display MPs App(). Optional. provided, App try set sensible colors.

title: Create or modify an OMs object — OMs
code: myOMs <- OMs()  Metadata(myOMs) <- data.frame()   # Design <- expand.grid(M=c(0.1, 0.2, 0.3), h=c(0.7,0.9)) #' Description <- list(c('Natural mortality (M) = 0.1', #'                       'Natural mortality (M) = 0.2', #'                       'Natural mortality (M) = 0.3'), #'                     c('Steepness (h) = 0.7', #'                       'Steepness (h) = 0.9')) #' Label <- list(c(M=0.1, M=0.2, M=0.3), #'                c(h=0.7, h=0.9)) #' myOMs <- OMs(Design, Description, Label)

title: Create a Slick object — Slick-class
Create a Slick object — Slick-class
text: Title Title Slick object. character string. multiple languages, use named list names: en, es, fr three supported languages. Subtitle Subtitle Slick object. character string named list languages: en, es, fr Date Either object class Date character string. Date Slick object created. Defaults Sys.Date() Author character vector name(s) author(s) Slick object Email character vector email addresses author(s). Optional. Must length Author Institution character vector institution details author(s). Optional. Must length Author Introduction Introduction text Slick object. Supports markdown formatting. multiple languages, use named list names: en, es, fr three supported languages. MPs object class MPs() OMs object class OMs() Boxplot object class Boxplot() Kobe object class Kobe() Quilt object class Quilt() Spider object class Spider() Timeseries object class Timeseries() Tradeoff object class Tradeoff()

title: Create a Slick object — Slick-class
code: mySlick <- Slick() Title(mySlick) <- 'This is the title' Subtitle(mySlick) <- 'This is the subtitle' Date(mySlick) <- Sys.Date()  Title(mySlick) #> [1] "This is the title" Subtitle(mySlick) #> [1] "This is the subtitle" Date(mySlick) #> [1] "2024-05-29"

title: Run the Shiny Application — run_app
text: Run Shiny Application

title: Run the Shiny Application — run_app
code: run_app(   onStart = NULL,   options = list(port = 3838, host = "0.0.0.0"),   enableBookmarking = NULL,   uiPattern = "/",   ... )

title: Run the Shiny Application — run_app
text: onStart function called app actually run. needed shinyAppObj, since shinyAppDir case, global.R file can used purpose. options Named options passed runApp call (can following: "port", "launch.browser", "host", "quiet", "display.mode" "test.mode"). can also specify width height parameters provide hint embedding environment ideal height/width app. enableBookmarking Can one "url", "server", "disable". default value, NULL, respect setting previous calls  enableBookmarking(). See enableBookmarking() information bookmarking app. uiPattern regular expression applied GET request determine whether ui used handle request. Note entire request path must match regular expression order match considered successful. ... arguments pass golem_opts. See ?golem::get_golem_options details.
